newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Fazio says time come to cut state spending.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Fazio says time come to cut state spending.

text.p: Bank of Italy governor Anotnio Fazio suggested on Monday that the time had come for Italy to cut back on public spending.

Quoting from the bible, Fazio told a conference in central Italy "There's a time to plant and a time to pluck up, a time to laugh and a time to weep, a time to love and a time to hate. And I say there is a time to increase public spending and a time to cut it."
Fazio said public spending represented 10 percent of gross domestic product in OECD countries in the 1930s. This rose to 47 percent in the 1980s.
While other states were now hacking back their public spending, Italy was slow in following suit, Fazio said. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
